greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of supernormal integer partitions of n.
comment: An integer partition is supernormal if either (1) it is of the form 1^n for some n >= 0, or (2a) it spans an initial interval of positive integers, and (2b) its multiplicities, sorted in weakly decreasing order, are themselves a supernormal integer partition.
example: The a(10) = 4 supernormal integer partitions are (4321), (33211), (322111), (1111111111).
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jul 24 2018
